# Function definition
```{r}
i = c(1:10000)
x = c(1:9)
calcor <- function(i) {
  y = sample(x, 9);
  cor(x, y, method="kendall")
}
rk = sapply(i, calcor)
```

## Summary
```{r}
summary(rk)
```
## Standard deviation
```{r}
sd(rk)
```

## Density plot
```{r}
plot(density(rk))
```

## Transform values
```{r}
transform <- function(i) {
  0.5 * log((1 + i) / (1 - i))
}
rkt = sapply(rk, transform)
```

## Summary
```{r}
summary(rkt)
```

## Standard deviation
```{r}
sd(rkt)
```

## Density plot (original scaling)
```{r}
plot(density(rkt))
```

## Density plot (adjusted scaling)
```{r}
plot(density(rkt), ylim=c(0,1.5), xlim=c(-1, 1))
```

Same conclusion as in previous example, flattening of distribution.
